name: guncat
short_description:
Guncat (Gpg UNencrypting CAT) was designed to tackle a problem encountered with (partially) PGP encrypted files (as encountered, e.g., in mailboxes): the encrypted sections of such files are relatively difficult to browse through.

Guncat acts like unix's cat command, but handles (partially) encrypted sections of processed files. Sections of guncat's input files which are surrounded by 
     -----BEGIN PGP MESSAGE-----
and
     -----END PGP MESSAGE-----
markers are decrypted before being concatenated to the std. output stream. 

Guncat's output (i.e., the standard output stream) may subsequently be processed by other programs, like grep or less.
summary: Guncat acts like unix's cat, decrypting pgp encrypted sections
